msContents.summary: Tax register, recording the daily collection of money taxes in the village of Karanis; the name of each tax-payer paying the poll-tax is cross-referenced with a page of another register, where taxpayers were listed geographically

msItemStruct.note: Due to the size of this tax roll (P.Mich. IV/1, 225 + IV/2, 358), its content has been divided in the present database into several cards (one for each column).
Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

supportDesc.support: 1 papyrus ; col. 183-184: 18 x 27 cm; total size: ***

condition.ab: Col. 184(?): broken off on the right (and on the left of col. [183])

layout.ab: Source of description: Recto, col. 184(?) (358F, l. 21-48)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Mysthes son of Patkonnis [and Ptolema grandson of Harobros] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 189)
Petheus son of Harsiesis [and Tapetheus] grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 201)
Psenesis son of Parmenion [and Tkonnos] grandson of Psenesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 248)
Anoubas son of Horos [and Tepheros] grandson of Anoubas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 151)
Ammonis (Ammonios) son of Pasoknopaios [and Thatres grandson of Limnaios] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 151)
Ptolemaios son of Papeis [and Thermouthis] grandson of Petheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 218)
Ptolemaios son of Ptolemaios neoteros [and Tasoucharion grandson of Petheus] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 219)
Petaus son of Petheus [and Tapasion] grandson of Petaus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Horos son of Menandros [and Soeris] grandson of Anchophis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 250)
Heron son of Ptolemaios [and Heras] grandson of Pnepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 171)
Pnepheros son of Ptolemaios [and Heras] grandson of Pnepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 213)
Ptolemaios son of Esouris [and Thaesis] grandson of Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)
Petaus son of Petheus [and Taseus] grandson of Pnepheros, [(hiereus)] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Herieus neoteros son of Horos [and Thaesis grandson of Pnepheros] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 163)
s name should be Tauris or Thaesis)
Kames son of Petheus [and Tkonnos grandson of Petheus] (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 180)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
